results.title: Ocean oddities
results.creator_credit: Noel Monkman, Australian Educational Films and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: The coral structure of the Great Barrier Reef provides protection for a number of creatures such as the stone-fish, the giant mantis shrimp,the crown of thorns seastar, the black beche-de-mer and the green turtle.

results.title: Ocean liners
results.brief_description: Brief but remarkable thorough document of the life of an ocean liner. Presents footage of ship construction in the shipyards and launching of the ship. Then goes into a description, using animated cross-sections, of the layout - cargo holds, fuel tanks, crew quarters, passenger quarters. Shows inspection of the crew prior to departure, life on board and the liner arriving at its destination.

results.title: Ocean challengers
results.creator_credit: David Perry, Brian Morris and Soundsense Film Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the epic voyage of the First fleet and contrasts it with the journey of group of adolescents who were prize-winners in an essay competition about the First Fleet. The students sailed from North Queensland to Sydney Harbour as crew members of a schooner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Perry, Brian Morris and Soundsense Film Productions

results.title: Ocean Boulevard
results.creator_credit: Rachael Ryan, Sonia Humphrey and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This drama follows a group of young people as they meet and interact. The group consists of two young army privates, two single girls and a girl already in a relationship. Through their interaction the film looks at issues such as self-worth, self-esteem, personal values, sexual identity and the way relationships are viewed.

results.title: Ocean's eleven
results.creator_credit: Lewis Milestone, Warner Bros Pictures and Dorchester
results.brief_description: Danny Ocean (Frank Sinatra) gathers together a group of ex-army buddies for an ambitious heist - the robbery of several casinos on New Year’s eve. His gang include playboy Jimmy (Peter Lawler), lounge lizard Sam (Dean Martin) and garbage man Josh (Sammy Davis Jnr) among others. At the time of production these very actors made up the crew known as the Rat Pack. Led by Sinatra, the Rat Pack were infamous for their carousing, womanising, drinking, entertaining and swinging image and in this film they do not stray far from their real life personas. “Ocean’s eleven” is not a film that treats the heist genre seriously in that it lacks any real tension of great films of that type. Rather, the film’s joys are derived from its 1960s aesthetic, the machinations of the sartorial Rat Pack at play, and the musical numbers courtesy of Davis and Martin. Also stars: Angie Dickinson , Cesar Romero, Shirley MacLaine, Joey Bishop and Red Skelton.

results.title: Ocean's eleven
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, Jerry Weintraub, NPV Entertainment, Village Roadshow Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Soderbergh followed up his Oscar winning film “Traffic” with “Ocean’s eleven” - a remake of the 1960 Rat Pack film (starring Sinatra, Dean Martin et al) of the same name. Like the original, the plot is a daring heist of several casinos in one grand night. Danny Ocean takes the lead role of the film as the gang chief and mastermind of the scheme. His unruly crew consist of Rusty (best buddy), Reuben (moneyman), Frank (croupier), Linus (pickpocket), Saul (aging con artist), Basher (explosives expert), Dell (technical expert), Virgil and Turk (two daft brothers providing comic relief) and Yen (acrobat). Ocean fails to tell the crew that his target (and motive) is to sting the new boyfriend of his ex-wife and owner of the casinos that will be hit. Soderbergh plays “Ocean’s eleven” largely for laughs, rather than with any tension typical of a caper film and with a touch of romance thrown in for good measure. Great care is taken to display the technical complexity of the job and dexterity of the crew, with much of the film devoted to the set-up. “Ocean’s eleven” has a cool, smooth engaging rhythm that prioritises aesthetics over any sense of real characterisation.

results.title: Occupy Wall Street protestors in New York City
results.brief_description: In 2011, the connectivity and speed of social media seemed promising for society and democracy. Platforms like Facebook, Twitter and YouTube were integral to mobilising people and coordinating protest movements like Occupy Wall Street, which aims to create greater economic equality.

constellations_primary.name: Fight for your right
constellations_primary.description: Real world revolution and the fictional representations that reflect the struggle for equality in the past, present and dystopian future.

results.title: Occupy Wall St
results.brief_description: Occupy Wall Street (OWS) was a protest movement that began on September 17, 2011, in Zuccotti Park, located in New York City’s Wall Street financial district, against economic inequality. The movement spread around the world, assisted by social media and extensive media coverage, demonstrating the power of the moving image to incite protests and action.

results.title: Occupied territory
results.creator_credit: Candace Reckinger and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: In a society plagued with decay and political chaos, a woman is arrested for the murder of her lover. This film is a portrayal of a female terrorist group and their actions of protest against our society’s exploitation of women’s bodies. The concepts that are communicated by the film are presented in an experimental form.

results.title: Occupational therapy
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
A vocational guidance film showing how occupational therapists assist disabled people, by devising jobs and exercises, to recover their sense of independence. Demonstrates techniques and shows training briefly.
